data.title: Sigma Phi Epsilon
data.meta_site_name: Office of the Dean of Students
data.text:
Affiliated Housing Program Participant

Chapter House

Closest Greek house to the OSU Campus (One block away). Newly remodeled

living room with one 85” HDTV, gas fireplace, and leather couches. Two

large, quiet study rooms. Brand new gym that has 15 thousand dollars worth of

equipment and includes two cable machines and two squat racks. Recently

acquired “backlot” adjacent to the house with full-size basketball

court/BBQ area/lawn under development. Weekday meals prepared by the chef, plus stocked kitchen on weekends, 30 member parking spots plus 6 spots for

guests.

Academics

1st in Fraternity GPA on the Oregon State Campus Chapter Cumulative GPA for 2012/2013 school year: 3.36. Up to $40,000 in scholarships given out to undergrads every year.

Leadership

SigEp typically has at least 10 brothers serving in various positions on ASOSU. Has won 14 Kerr cups, which are awarded annually to the most outstanding IFC Fraternity at Oregon State University. SigEp at Oregon State currently holds the most Buchanan cups out of every SigEp chapter in the nation. This award is given out to the top 10% of SigEp fraternities every two years.

Athletics

Intramural Cup champions 2012-2013 and 8 of the last 9 years. All-University Dodgeball and Capture the Flag Champions 2013-2014. Greek Champions for Basketball 2013-2014. All-University Softball Champions 2012-2013. All-University Soccer Runner's Up 2012-2013. Greek Champions for Flag Football, Indoor Baseball, and Dodgeball 2012-2013.

Social Life

A house dance every term with Sweethearts in the winter, and Fireman's Ball in the spring. Scheduled Events include Mom's Weekend, Dad's Weekend, Homecoming, IFC Sing, and several others. Brotherhood Events range from Road trips and Barbecues to House Retreats and Camping Trips.
